meanings.definition: Used as an adjective to express annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: That doggone traffic jam made me late for work.
meanings.sent2: I can't find my doggone keys anywhere.
meanings.sent3: Well, doggone it, I forgot my lunch at home again!
meanings.sent4: The doggone rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The doggone mosquito kept buzzing around my head all night.

meanings.definition: Used as an adverb to intensify a statement.
meanings.sent1: She ran doggone fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: I'm doggone tired after working all day.
meanings.sent3: He was doggone excited to see his favorite band in concert.
meanings.sent4: The wind was blowing doggone hard during the storm.
meanings.sent5: I'm doggone sure I left my phone on the kitchen counter.

meanings.definition: Used as an interjection to express surprise or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: Doggone! I can't believe I won the raffle.
meanings.sent2: Well, doggone, that was a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: Doggone, that was a close call with the car almost hitting us.
meanings.sent4: The magician pulled a doggone rabbit out of his hat!
meanings.sent5: Doggone, that movie was so scary I couldn't sleep.
